name: 機器學習
description: This course covers methods that computer programs can use to adapt themselves to perform better on similar problems in the future, that is they learn from their experience. Special emphasis is given for machine learning techniques useful for intelligent robotics systems. Lectures will use python and matplotlib for most sample code.
goals: Understanding fundamental issues in machine learning including overfitting,local vs global methods, and inductive bias.
Use of programming to simulate and analyze complex learning problems that arise in the area of intelligent robotics.
Evaluate performance of machine learning algorithms on robot control systems.
syllabus:
Week 1: Concept Learning: version spaces inductive bias  
Week 2: learning of disjunctions, the overfitting problem., case-based meta learning  
Week 3: Decision trees: ID3 and C4.5  
Week 4: Gradient descent, linear regression  
Week 5: Neural nets, backpropagation  
Week 6: Deep learning  
Week 7: Instance-based learning, k-nearest neighbor algorithm,  
Week 8: Case-based reasoning, Locally weighted regression  
Week 9: Midterm  
Week 10:. Learning sets of rules: sequential covering algorithm,  
Week 11: Recommender systems  
Week 12: Logistic Regression  
Week 13: Support vector machines  
Week 14: Advanced support vector machines  
Week 15: Genetic algorithms: classification using genetic algorithms  
Week 16: Genetic Programming  
Week 17: Dynamic programming, Reinforcement learning  
Week 18: Final Exam
